place.name: HARPSWELL
place.gazetteerText: HARPSWELL, a parish in Gainsborough district, Lincoln; on the Wolds, 5 miles SSE of Northorpe r. station, and 8 E of Gainsborough. Post-town, Kirton-Lindsey. Acres, 2,180. Real property, £2,818. Pop., 104. Houses, 16. The property is all in one estate. The parish is a meet for the Barton hounds. The living is a donative in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £41. Patrons, the Whichcote Family. The church is plain, but good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
